page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are the sites of several bronze-age standing stones, e.g. at Auchendreich, and one remaining stone from a circle at Millplough. Also, two Kists have been found in the area, one near Mill of Allardyce, and one on the Law. An aerial photograph taken in 1976 shows crop marks of two ramparts of a prehistoric camp or fort of Castle Dykes at Kirkton. Mr Watt(text p.4) tells the story of a stone thrown by the Devil from Gobbs to Kinneff, which split, one part landing towards Barras and the other at Largie. The stone is known as the Devil's Stone with the imprint of the Devil's elbow and hand visible on the stone. There are many agates to be found especially in the disused quarries, e.g. near the Post Office, and children enjoy searching for them.
